nl.idgis.geoide.documentcache.service

Class DefaultDocumentCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.idgis.geoide.documentcache.service.DefaultDocumentCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, DocumentCache, DocumentStore

    public class DefaultDocumentCache
extends Object
implements DocumentCache, Closeable
    DefaultDocumentCache is an implementation of DocumentCache that temporarily stores documents in a store provided by MapDB and using an Akka actor system for scheduling.

    • Method Detail

      • createInMemoryCache

        public static DefaultDocumentCache createInMemoryCache(akka.actor.ActorRefFactory actorRefFactory,
                                                       StreamProcessor streamProcessor,
                                                       String cacheName,
                                                       long ttlSeconds,
                                                       double maxSizeInGigabytes,
                                                       DocumentStore readThroughStore)
        Creates an in-memory cache with an optional read-through store.
        Parameters:
        actorRefFactory - The factory used to create actors for scheduling.
        streamProcessor - The stream processor used to process streams that are consumed and produced by this cache.
        cacheName - The name of the cache. The cache name is reflected in the names of the scheduling actors and the name of the MapDB store.
        ttlSeconds - The number of seconds documents should (at least) be retained in the cache.
        maxSizeInGigabytes - The maximum size in gigabytes of the in-memory cache. When this size is exceeded, storing new documents will fail with an exception.
        readThroughStore - An optional read-through store that is accessed when fetching documents from the cache that have no entry.
        Returns:
        The created DefaultDocumentCache instance.

      • createTempFileCache

        public static DefaultDocumentCache createTempFileCache(akka.actor.ActorRefFactory actorRefFactory,
                                                       StreamProcessor streamProcessor,
                                                       String cacheName,
                                                       long ttlSeconds,
                                                       DocumentStore readThroughStore)
                                                throws IOException
        Creates a cache of arbitrary size in a temporary file. The location of the temporary file is platform dependent.
        Parameters:
        actorRefFactory - The factory used to create actors for scheduling.
        streamProcessor - The stream processor used to process streams that are consumed and produced by this cache.
        cacheName - The name of the cache. The cache name is reflected in the names of the scheduling actors and the name of the MapDB store.
        ttlSeconds - The number of seconds documents should (at least) be retained in the cache.
        readThroughStore - An optional read-through store that is accessed when fetching documents from the cache that have no entry.
        Returns:
        The created DefaultDocumentCache instance.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown when the temporary file could not be created.

      • createFileCache

        public static DefaultDocumentCache createFileCache(akka.actor.ActorRefFactory actorRefFactory,
                                                   StreamProcessor streamProcessor,
                                                   String cacheName,
                                                   long ttlSeconds,
                                                   File file,
                                                   DocumentStore readThroughStore)
        Parameters:
        actorRefFactory - The factory used to create actors for scheduling.
        streamProcessor - The stream processor used to process streams that are consumed and produced by this cache.
        cacheName - The name of the cache. The cache name is reflected in the names of the scheduling actors and the name of the MapDB store.
        ttlSeconds - The number of seconds documents should (at least) be retained in the cache.
        file - The file to create a database in.
        readThroughStore - An optional read-through store that is accessed when fetching documents from the cache that have no entry.
        Returns:
        The created DefaultDocumentCache instance.

      • store

        public play.libs.F.Promise<Document> store(URI uri)
        Stores a document with the given URI in the cache. This method only works if the cache implementation has the ability to read documents from a read-through store in case of a cache miss. If read-through capabilities are not present the returned promise always raises a DocumentCacheException. If a document with that URI is previously cached, it is overwritten.
        Specified by:
        store in interface DocumentCache
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI of the document to store.
        Returns:
        A promise that resolves to the stored document, or a DocumentCacheException if the document couldn't be fetched or storing the document failed.

      • store

        public play.libs.F.Promise<Document> store(URI uri,
                                           nl.idgis.ogc.util.MimeContentType contentType,
                                           org.reactivestreams.Publisher<akka.util.ByteString> body)
        Stores a document in the cache by providing an publisher that produces ByteStrings containing the document body. If a document with that URI previously exists it gets overwritten. The entire producer is consumed and closed after use.
        Specified by:
        store in interface DocumentCache
        Parameters:
        uri - The unique URI of the document to store.
        contentType - The content type of the document.
        body - The document body.
        Returns:
        A promise that resolves to the stored document, or raises a DocumentCacheException if the document couldn't be stored.

      • store

        public play.libs.F.Promise<Document> store(URI uri,
                                           nl.idgis.ogc.util.MimeContentType contentType,
                                           byte[] data)
        Stores a document in the cache by providing a byte array containing the document body. If a document with that URI previously exists it gets overwritten.
        Specified by:
        store in interface DocumentCache
        Parameters:
        uri - The unique URI of the document to store.
        contentType - The content type of the document.
        data - The document body.
        Returns:
        A promise that resolves to the stored document, or raises a DocumentCacheException if the document couldn't be stored.

      • store

        public play.libs.F.Promise<Document> store(URI uri,
                                           nl.idgis.ogc.util.MimeContentType contentType,
                                           InputStream inputStream)
        Stores a document in the cache by providing an InputStream containing the document body. If a document with that URI previously exists it gets overwritten. The entire InputStream is consumed and closed after use.
        Specified by:
        store in interface DocumentCache
        Parameters:
        uri - The unique URI of the document to store.
        contentType - The content type of the document.
        inputStream - The document body.
        Returns:
        A promise that resolves to the stored document, or raises a DocumentCacheException if the document couldn't be stored.

      • fetch

        public play.libs.F.Promise<Document> fetch(URI uri)
        Retrieves a document from the store identified by the given URI.
        Specified by:
        fetch in interface DocumentStore
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI identification of the document.
        Returns:
        A promise that resolves to the document, or raises a DocumentCacheException if the document couldn't be found or if an error occured during retrieval.

      • getTtl

        public play.libs.F.Promise<Long> getTtl()
        Returns a promise that resolves to the "time to live" for documents stored in the cache in milliseconds. After storing a document it is not guaranteed to be present in the cache after this time expires.
        Specified by:
        getTtl in interface DocumentCache
        Returns:
        A promise that resolves to the cache TTL in milliseconds.
